description: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said the army intends to remain indefinitely in areas of strategic import in Gaza and elsewhere along its frontiers.
title: Israel Won’t Withdraw From Security Zones, Defense Minister Says

description: 'Why is the government of El Salvador continuing to imprison a man [where] they have no evidence he's committed any crime?' Chris Van Hollen asks.
title: Maryland Senator Says El Salvador Denied Him Meeting, Phone Call With Deported Man

description: Migrants from Bangladesh, Colombia, Morocco, Tunisia, Egypt, India, and Kosovo are unlikely to have asylum granted, the European Commission said.
title: EU Suggests Fast-Tracking Asylum Claims by Migrants From 7 Countries to Speed Deportation

description: The agency that provides air traffic control for Canada’s airports is warning travellers at Vancouver’s airport of flight delays over what it says are “resource constraints.” Nav Canada says in a social media post that passengers need to check the status of their flights with their airlines before they head to Vancouver International Airport. The […]
title: Nav Canada Warns to Expect Flight Delays at Vancouver International Airport

description: Washington is reportedly asking other countries to reduce trade and economic ties with Beijing in exchange for tariff cuts.
title: US Seeks to Isolate China in Trade Talks With Other Nations: Report

description: The Alberta government has introduced legislation this week that seeks to compel people with serious substance addictions to undergo involuntary treatment. Bill 53, also known as the Compassionate Intervention Act, was presented in the provincial legislature on April 15. The first of its kind in the country, the act would allow relatives, guardians, health-care professionals, […]
title: Alberta Moves Ahead With Planned Involuntary Addiction Treatment Law

description: Crown prosecutors are seeking two years of prison time for Freedom Convoy organizers Tamara Lich and Chris Barber, after the two were found guilty of mischief but had most of their other charges dropped, Barber’s lawyer has confirmed to The Epoch Times. “The Crown prosecutor wants to lock Tamara Lich and me in prison for […]
title: Crown Seeking Two Years in Prison for Lich and Barber Following Mischief Verdict

description: News Analysis Around two years ago, a surge of intelligence leaks about China’s interference in Canada’s elections forced the hand of the government to hold an inquiry into foreign meddling. Now, national security experts and China watchers are concerned that Beijing is getting a pass in the current election campaign, and some even fear that […]
title: Beijing’s Interference Largely Overlooked in Election Campaign, Inviting Further Infiltration, Analysts Warn

description: The CEO of the American Chamber of Commerce in Australia says the country can adapt to the shifting trade landscape.
title: Australia’s Challenge: Compete or Be Left Behind in the New US Trade Order

description: The federal government’s lowering of the consumer carbon tax rate to zero will temporarily reduce Canada’s inflation rate by around 30 percent, according to the Bank of Canada. The removal of the federal fuel charge will pull down Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation by 0.7 points from April 2025 to March 2026, according to the […]
title: Consumer Carbon Tax Removal to Lower Inflation by 30 Percent: Bank of Canada

description: McGill University has obtained a 10-day court order against a pro-Palestinian student group forbidding protests on campus. A Quebec Superior Court judge granted the injunction Tuesday against Students for Palestinian Honour and Resistance. Group members are not permitted to block or obstruct McGill entrances; engage in protests within five metres of any McGill building; or […]
title: Court Bans Pro-Palestinian Protests on McGill University Campus for 10 Days

description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth greets Salvadoran Defense Minister René Francis Merino Monroy and holds a bilateral meeting at 10 a.m. ET on April 16.

description: The Trump administration ordered a U.S. withdrawal from WHO as well as the pandemic treaty negotiations earlier this year.
title: WHO Announces ‘Pandemic Agreement’ Years After COVID-19

description: Crude oil pipeline operator South Bow Corp. says its Keystone system has restarted after a rupture last week in North Dakota. The Calgary-based company says it has repaired and replaced the affected pipe and recovered most of the more than 556,000 litres that leaked onto farmland. South Bow says it’s now working to clean up […]
title: Keystone Pipeline Restarts After Rupture in North Dakota

description: Women's rights campaigners hailed victory for 'reality over paperwork' as For Women Scotland won a battle with government over the legal definition of a woman.
title: Transgender Men Are Not Women, UK Supreme Court Rules

description: A 16-year-old boy who was stabbed Tuesday evening in Montreal has died. Police confirmed his death today—the city’s eighth reported homicide in 2025. The teenager was stabbed in the Côte-des-Neiges—Notre-Dame-de-Grâce borough. He was transported to hospital where he succumbed to his injuries. Const. Raphaël Bergeron says police have not made any arrests in the case. […]
title: Boy, 16, Dies After Stabbing in Montreal; City’s Eighth Homicide in 2025

description: A business group representing manufacturers is calling for less regulation and lower taxes as part of its policy recommendations to support a sector under threat from U.S. tariffs. Canadian Manufacturers and Exporters says whoever wins the federal election has to act decisively to reposition Canada’s economy for growth. Chief executive Dennis Darby says the economic […]
title: Manufacturers Call for Bold Policy Changes as Sector Faces Threats From US Tariffs

description: Ukraine's martial law system allows for military conscription and the suspension of certain political activities, including regular democratic elections.
title: Ukraine’s Parliament Extends Martial Law, Pushing Back Election Timeline

description: The Saskatchewan government has introduced legislation that would categorize some drugs, like fentanyl and methamphetamine, as “street weapons.” The bill, introduced on April 14, will amend The Safe Public Spaces (Street Weapons) Act, according to an April 15 news release. The legislation is expected to be passed in the spring session and be put in […]
title: Sask. Introduces Legislation to Label Fentanyl, Meth as ‘Street Weapons’

description: A paramilitary leader said they were 'building the only realistic future for Sudan.'
title: Rebels Declare Rival Government in Sudan After 2 Years of Civil War

description: Real estate watchers say the Bank of Canada’s decision to hold its key policy rate steady at 2.75 percent will likely keep a sluggish housing market at the status quo. Wednesday’s announcement marked the first time the central bank has left the benchmark rate unchanged following seven consecutive cuts since June. Ratesdotca mortgage and real […]
title: Rate Hold Means Status Quo for Canada’s Struggling Housing Market: Experts

description: 'Hopefully something can be worked out,' the president said.
title: Trump Says He’s Joining Tariff Talks With Japanese Officials

description: A driver who hit four pedestrians on a walkway on Toronto Metropolitan University’s downtown campus on April 15 may have been targeting a specific individual, police say. title: Driver May Have Targeted Pedestrian When 4 People Struck on Toronto Campus Path: Police

description: The report said outpatients are subjected long waits to receive a diagnosis or treatment, poor communication, and difficulty in trying to navigate services.

description: The Bank of Canada is holding its key interest rate at 2.75 percent, warning that uncertainty around U.S. tariffs is diminishing Canada’s economic growth prospects and raising inflation expectations. “The path for U.S. trade policy remains highly unpredictable. There is also considerable uncertainty about the impacts of a trade war on our economy,” Bank of […]
title: Bank of Canada Holds Interest Rate Steady at 2.75 Percent, Says US Trade Policy ‘Highly Unpredictable’

description: A contractor has been killed and another person hurt in a fire in a gas plant north of Fort St. John, B.C. description: On the day of the French-language leaders’ debate, the organizers have announced the Green Party will not be allowed to participate. description: Authorities are investigating whether coordinated prison attacks stem from narco-gang activity or unrest linked to pro-prisoner activist groups.
